newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombian stocks close higher on local demand.
newsitem.headline: Colombian stocks close higher on local demand.

text.p: Colombian stocks edged up for the third consecutive session on the back of moderate demand from local investors.
Bogota's IBB index rose 0.3 percent to 839.2 on a 948.4 million peso volume, while Medellin's IBOMED general price index gained 0.3 percent to close at 13,294.8 amid a 1.8 billion peso trade.
"The market moved a little more than Monday but trading volumes were still small," one Bogota broker said.
